授業目的:
The main purpose of this course is to improve and develop students’ English communication skills. This will mainly be done through participation in group discussions. The course will follow a functional / topical approach. Weekly lessons will focus on functional language use in the context of communicative encounters about a variety of interesting topics. In-class participation will require students to express and share their ideas using functional language and other communication skills in group discussions.
In each class, students will be required to participate in extended discussions with their classmates. Students will improve their fluency and confidence to use English for communication. Preparation activities will help students to think about topics and to use functional language naturally and successfully to express ideas. In-class communication activities and homework preparation will aim to improve students’ ability to express themselves about a variety of topics. Students will be required to think about and discuss their ideas critically. Students’ will improve their skills to use English in a professional capacity by planning and giving an effective presentation in English.
到達目標:
• To improve students’ overall communication skills and competence.
• To improve students’ fluency and confidence to use English interactively.
• To discuss a single topic with peers in groups for an extended period of time (10 minutes or more).
• To improve and develop students’ use of functional language and essential skills to organize, express, and inquire about ideas.
• To develop and improve students’ ability to be effective speakers and active listeners.
• To improve students’ ability to use strategic skills to achieve equal participation and balanced interaction with others.
• To explore and express ideas interactively about personal, global, cultural, and other topics.
• To improve students’ ability to successfully interact and collaborate with peers by participating in a variety of classroom configurations, including pair and group work.
• To create a comfortable classroom environment for learning, communicating and sharing of ideas.
• To improve and develop students’ critical thinking skills through the exploration and discussion of various topics.
• To develop students’ ability to successfully plan and give an effective presentation.
特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法: This course will be in-person at the university. Weekly lessons will follow a functional / topical approach. Students will learn to use and practice functional language and essential skills to express their ideas about a variety of topics. Lessons will be student-centered. Teacher-fronted activities may include providing explanations about language use and topics, monitoring students, and giving appropriate feedback.
